alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Ripley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 6:11PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHEASTERN RIPLEY AND NORTHWESTERN DEARBORN COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 611 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Batesville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Batesville, Brookville, Oldenburg, Lake Santee, Sunman, St. Leon, Huntersville, Hamburg, Ballstown, Penntown, Weisburg, Interstate 74 at State Route 101, Peppertown, Lawrenceville, Saint Peter and New Alsace. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
